intro: Hieracium luridum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium luridum typically grows in open habitats like meadows and grasslands, often in disturbed soils. It is a perennial plant with a rosette of basal leaves and stems that can reach up to 30 centimeters in height.
